title: 2D卷积 Inception 模块示意图
description: Inception 风格的多尺度卷积模块
prompt:
Create an Inception module diagram.

STRUCTURE (top to bottom):
INPUT:
- Single rectangle at top

FOUR PARALLEL BRANCHES:
Branch 1: Single small square (1x1 conv)
Branch 2: Small square → Medium square (1x1 → 3x3)
Branch 3: Small square → Large square (1x1 → 5x5)
Branch 4: Grid pattern → Small square (pooling → 1x1)

All branches start from input and run vertically downward

CONCATENATION:
- All 4 branches merge into single wide rectangle

OUTPUT:
- Single rectangle at bottom

VISUAL STYLE:
- Different sizes represent different kernel sizes
- Light blue fill for all conv blocks
- Arrows showing data flow


CRITICAL STYLE REQUIREMENTS for IEEE academic publication:
1. Visual Style: Clean vector-like appearance, sharp edges, professional technical diagram
2. Color Palette:
   - Primary: IEEE blue (#0076A8)
   - Secondary: Dark gray (#333333)
   - Background: Pure white (#FFFFFF)
   - Accent: Light gray (#E5E5E5)
3. Design: Minimal shadows, flat design, no decorative elements
4. Typography style: Sans-serif (but NO actual text on image)
5. High contrast suitable for print reproduction
6. IMPORTANT: Generate ONLY visual elements, NO text labels or annotations

Layout: Vertical with parallel horizontal branches
generated_description:
Below is a **complete, printable‑ready specification** for an IEEE‑style 2‑D Inception module diagram.  
Everything is expressed in absolute units (mm) so that the diagram can be reproduced at any size while preserving the exact proportions required for conference papers.  
The description is written as a **step‑by‑step build‑up** that can be followed directly in **draw.io (diagrams.net)**, **Adobe Illustrator**, **Inkscape**, or any other vector‑drawing tool that supports exact‑size objects and hex‑color fills.

---

## 1. Global Canvas & Units  

| Parameter | Value | Comment |
|-----------|-------|---------|
| Canvas size (final figure) | **180 mm × 120 mm** | Fits comfortably inside a single column of most IEEE conference templates (column width ≈ 88 mm; this figure occupies two columns). |
| Unit system | **Millimetres (mm)** | All dimensions, line‑weights and corner‑radii are given in mm. |
| Grid / Snap | Enable “Snap to grid” with a **5 mm** grid; turn off “Pixel snapping”. |
| Canvas background | **#FFFFFF** (pure white) | Must stay empty – no shading or pattern. |

*If your final page width is 8.5 in (≈ 215.9 mm) you can scale the whole figure to 80 % of the page width while preserving the aspect ratio (180 × 120 mm → 0.8 × 180 ≈ 144 mm wide).*

---

## 2. Colour Palette (IEEE‑compliant)

| Role | Hex | Usage |
|------|-----|-------|
| **Primary (fill)** | **#0076A8** | All convolutional blocks (1×1, 3×3, 5×5, pooling‐1×1). |
| **Secondary (stroke)** | **#333333** | All rectangle borders and arrows. |
| **Accent (light‑gray background for arrows)** | **#E5E5E5** | Arrowheads and optional inner‑fill of pooling window (optional, can be omitted). |
| **Text colour** | **#000000** | *Never actually printed on the figure* – only used internally to label objects while building; delete before export. |
| **Background** | **#FFFFFF** | Canvas colour (already defined). |

*All fills are solid, no gradients. All strokes are 0.5 pt (≈ 0.176 mm) – thin enough for print but still visible.*

---

## 3. Shape & Corner‑Radius Specifications  

| Element | Width (mm) | Height (mm) | Corner radius (mm) | Stroke width (pt) |
|---------|------------|------------|-------------------|-------------------|
| **Input rectangle** | 140 | 20 | 2 | 0.5 |
| **Branch output rectangles** (four of them) | 30 | 20 | 2 | 0.5 |
| **Convolutional blocks** (inner squares) | 12 | 12 | 1 | 0.5 |
| **Pooling window** (grid pattern) | 30 | 20 (same as branch) | 2 | 0.5 |
| **Concatenation output rectangle** | 120 | 20 | 2 | 0.5 |
| **Arrow shaft** | — | — | — | 0.3 pt (hairline) |
| **Arrowhead** | – | – | – | Filled with **#333333**, 4 pt (≈ 1.4 mm) equilateral triangle |

*All rectangles are **axis‑aligned** (no rotation). The inner convolutional squares are centred inside their parent rectangle with a 4 mm margin on every side.*

---

## 4. Exact Layout & Coordinate System  

We use the **origin (0,0) at the top‑left corner of the canvas**.  
All Y‑coordinates increase downward; X‑coordinates increase to the right.

| Object | Top‑left corner (X,Y) | Width × Height | Right‑bottom corner (X,Y) |
|--------|----------------------|----------------|---------------------------|
| **Canvas** | 0,0 | 180 × 120 | 180,120 |
| **Input block** | 20,20 | 140 × 20 | 160,40 |
| **Branch 1 (1×1 conv)** | 20,50 | 30 × 20 | 50,70 |
| **Branch 2 (1×1 → 3×3)** | 70,50 | 30 × 20 | 100,70 |
| **Branch 3 (1×1 → 5×5)** | 120,50 | 30 × 20 | 150,70 |
| **Branch 4 (pool → 1×1)** | 170,50 | 30 × 20 | 200,70 *(note: this branch extends just outside the canvas; we will shift it left a little)* |
| **Concatenation merge point** | 30,90 | 120 × 20 | 150,110 |
| **Output block** | 30,110 | 120 × 20 | 150,130 |

**Important adjustment for Branch 4:**  
Because the canvas width is only 180 mm, the branch that starts at X = 170 mm would overflow. Instead, **move Branch 4 left by 30 mm** so that it shares the same X‑range as the other three branches:

- Branch 4 top‑left: **(140,50)**, width = 30 mm → right‑bottom **(170,70)**.  
- This keeps **all four branches inside the 0‑180 mm X‑range**.

Thus the final X‑positions of the four branch origins are:

| Branch | X‑origin |
|--------|----------|
| 1 (1×1) | 20 |
| 2 (1×1→3×3) | 70 |
| 3 (1×1→5×5) | 120 |
| 4 (pool→1×1) | 140 |

All branches share the same vertical span **Y = 50 → 70 mm**.

---

## 5. Visual Construction Order  

1. **Canvas** – fill with **#FFFFFF**.  
2. **Input rectangle** – fill **#FFFFFF**, stroke **#333333**, radius 2 mm.  
3. **Four branch containers** (the “branch slots”) – each 30 × 20 mm, positioned directly under the input block with a **10 mm vertical gap**.  
   - These containers are *only guides*; they will not be drawn as separate shapes later – they are the space where the internal elements sit.  
4. **Inside each branch** draw the nested elements (see sub‑steps).  
5. **Concatenation rectangle** – centred horizontally at X = 30 mm, width = 120 mm, top‑left **(30,90)**, fill **#FFFFFF**, stroke **#333333**, radius 2 mm.  
6. **Output rectangle** – same size as concatenation, placed directly under it (Y = 110).  

---

## 6. Detailed Element Construction (per branch)

### 6.1. Branch 1 – Single 1×1 Convolution  

| Step | Action | Coordinates / Size | Fill / Stroke |
|------|--------|--------------------|---------------|
| 1 | Draw a **12 × 12 mm square** centred inside the branch slot. | Top‑left of square: **(branchX + 9, branchY + 4)** → (29,58) for Branch 1. | Fill **#0076A8**, stroke **#333333** (0.5 pt), radius 1 mm. |
| 2 | No further layers – this is the final element of Branch 1. |

### 6.2. Branch 2 – 1×1 →
